sentences.sContent: I like the angstrom. It is 10 to the minus 10 meters.
sentences.sContent_eng: I like the angstrom. It is 10 to the minus 10 meters.
sentences.sCn: 我喜欢单位，埃，它等于10的负10次方米。

sentences.sContent: So that works out, an angstrom is 10 to the minus 10 meters.
sentences.sContent_eng: So that works out, an angstrom is 10 to the minus 10 meters.
sentences.sCn: 这样可以计算出，一埃等于10的负10次方米。

sentences.sContent: I like the angstrom because atomic dimensions are conveniently measured by angstroms.
sentences.sContent_eng: I like the angstrom because atomic dimensions are conveniently measured by angstroms.
sentences.sCn: 我喜，埃，因为原子大小的东西,用埃来度量更方便。

trans.tranOther: a unit of length equal to 10–10 metre, used principally to express the wavelengths of electromagnetic radiations
